title: ADVISORY: President Obama to Travel to Colorado Springs, CO | whitehouse.gov
content:
The White House
Office of the Press Secretary


For Immediate Release
May 30, 2016

 



ADVISORY: President Obama to Travel to Colorado Springs, CO





  WASHINGTON, DC – On Thursday, June 2, the President will deliver the commencement address to the 2016 graduates of the United States Air Force Academy. The U.S. Air Force Academy is recognized for educating and training some of the nation’s most dedicated leaders, and the President looks forward to thanking them for their service.

  The arrival and departure of Air Force One are open to pre-credentialed media but closed to the public. The President’s remarks at the United States Air Force Academy are open to pre-credentialed media who have pre-registered with the Air Force Academy Public Affairs Office.  Registration has closed for this event. 

  The President’s remarks will be streamed live at: obamawhitehouse.archives.gov/live.

  Members of the media who wish to cover the arrival of Air Force One must RSVP via the following link by 2:00PM MT/4:00PM ET, Tuesday, May 31: https://obamawhitehouse.archives.gov/webform/media-rsvp-air-force-one-arrival-colorado-springs-co

  Members of the media who wish to cover the departure of Air Force One must RSVP via the following link by 2:00PM MT/4:00PM ET, Tuesday, May 31: https://obamawhitehouse.archives.gov/webform/media-rsvp-air-force-one-departure-colorado-springs-co
